deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 16. Order within 6 hrs 51 mins
body.description: Seventh Generation Free and Clear Baby Diapers Newborn (up to 10 lb.) - 36 Diaper(s) Seventh Generation Free and Clear Baby Diapers Newborn (up to 10 lb.) offer soft, cloth-like comfort and premium absorbency. In addition to keeping your baby dry, the super absorbent polymer is non-toxic and hypoallergenic. Chlorine Free Baby Diapers feature stretchy leg gathers and resealable closure tabs. As always, Seventh Generation diapers are free of chlorine processing; they are also free of fragrances, latex and petroleum-based lotions, so you get to decide what touches your baby's sensitive skin. Seventh Generation Chlorine Free Baby Diapers now have an improved environmental footprint, due to a redesigned core that is more efficient at absorption and uses less processed chlorine free wood pulp. Newborn: up to 10 lbs., 36 diapers Wood pulp processed without chemicals containing chlorine Hypo-allergenic Fragrance and latex free Premium fit and absorbency If every household in the U.S with babies replaced just one package of diapers processed with chemicals containing chlorine with their chlorine free diapers, that would prevent 2,800 lbs of chlorinated hydrocarbons form polluting the air, lakes and streams.Your choice of Seventh Generation chlorine free products can help reduce the amount of chlorinated toxins released into the environment and help make the world a healthier place for your family and generations to come. Seventh Generation discloses all ingredients. You have the right to know what makes their diapers safe for the environment and your baby as well as effective at keeping your baby dry and comfortable. They include a list of ingredients on all their baby care products. Seventh Generation is committed to becoming the world's most trusted brand of authentic, safe, and environmentally-responsible products for a healthy home.

productInformation.value: #45,514 in Baby (See Top 100 in Baby) #414 in Disposable Diapers

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2014
reviews.reviewText: I like that there's supposedly no harsh chemicals and such, but having a pee indicator would make these diapers great. I'd rather buy the Target brand diapers, which are awesome and the cheapest we have found.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No other disposable would do
reviews.reviewText: I love seventh generation diapers... held all her blow outs, never leaked, very trustworthy.We cloth diaper now but used newborn and size one the first month, and sometimes when our cloth diapers don't fit right we get frustrated and wish we were still using these ! But overall cloth is fantastic (I super recommend sunbaby's, the best fit and bang for your buck and they're so soft inside and also happy heiny's.)Also another thing I loved about these diapers is that she never got a rash with them. Why would you use any other disposables? These are affordable (at our local grocery store we get them on sale often for $9.99), don't cause rashes, are chlorine free, and don't leak. SOOO no need for any other kind!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars irritated my baby's butt more than regular diapers
reviews.reviewText: This is the first time I bought chlorine free diapers in the hopes that they would be less irritating to my newborn's butt. First of all, the newborn size are larger than Huggies or Pampers, I would say they are the same size as size 1 in other diapers. I couldn't even use them at first because they were too large and have no cut out for the umbilical cord. I did not like the plastic feel of the outside of the diaper and the inside felt rough to me but I wanted to give them a shot anyway. After using them for about a day my baby's but became more red than it had been before and continued to be through multiple diaper changes. After I switched back to using Huggies for a day the irritation cleared up. I will not be buying chlorine free diapers of any brand again, they are all just going to a landfill anyway. Instead I am going to research to find reliable cloth diapers to use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not a fan of these diapers
reviews.reviewText: Not impressed, the diapers are stiff compared to other brands and leaks occurred a few times when they should have been easily contained. I like the concept, but the product is not worth the extra cost.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2014
reviews.reviewText: These are not as soft on baby's skin as regular pampers. Scratchy and not as absorbent. Will not buy again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good diapers, no leaks!
reviews.reviewText: These work well - no leaks and price is comparable to Pampers. I like that they are brown, which gives the appearance of no chlorine or dyes as they are advertised. I substituted with the Touch of Cotton because it was all the store had. After 3 leaks in one day I scrapped the rest. Also, touch of cotton are white which seems like they are bleached.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2016
reviews.reviewText: Great for skinny babies!! No leaks and gentle on the skin!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars No great diapers.
reviews.reviewText: These diapers do not work. I ordered both the newborn and size two. Neither size worked with our newborn, nor when he was a month old. They leak, period. Very disappointed. They may be chlorine free, but they need to work.
